  proposition: Mingqi Gao et al. published a paper on human-like summarization evaluation using ChatGPT in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Mingqi Gao|PUBLISHED_IN|2023
    ChatGPT|EVALUATED_FOR|human-like summarization

    entity-entity relationships:
    Mingqi Gao|RESEARCHED|ChatGPT

  proposition: Nick McKenna et al. investigated sources of hallucination by large language models on inference tasks in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Nick McKenna|PUBLISHED_IN|2023

    entity-entity relationships:
    Nick McKenna|INVESTIGATED|large language models

  proposition: Jason Wei et al. studied emergent abilities of large language models in a 2022 research paper.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Jason Wei|PUBLISHED_IN|2022

    entity-entity relationships:
    Jason Wei|STUDIED|large language models

  proposition: Simon Frieder et al. examined the mathematical capabilities of ChatGPT in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Simon Frieder|PUBLISHED_IN|2023

    entity-entity relationships:
    Simon Frieder|EXAMINED|ChatGPT

  proposition: Hanmeng Liu et al. evaluated the logical reasoning ability of ChatGPT and GPT-4 in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Hanmeng Liu|PUBLISHED_IN|2023

    entity-entity relationships:
    Hanmeng Liu|EVALUATED|ChatGPT
    Hanmeng Liu|EVALUATED|GPT-4

  proposition: Liangming Pan et al. proposed Logic-LM to empower large language models with symbolic solvers for faithful logical reasoning in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Liangming Pan|PUBLISHED_IN|2023

    entity-entity relationships:
    Liangming Pan|PROPOSED|Logic-LM
    Logic-LM|EMPOWERS|large language models

  proposition: Zhenwen Liang et al. created MathChat, a benchmark for mathematical reasoning and instruction following in multi-turn interactions in 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zhenwen Liang|PUBLISHED_IN|2024
    MathChat|TYPE|benchmark

    entity-entity relationships:
    Zhenwen Liang|CREATED|MathChat

  proposition: Karl Cobbe et al. worked on training verifiers to solve math word problems in 2021.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Karl Cobbe|PUBLISHED_IN|2021

    entity-entity relationships:
    Karl Cobbe|RESEARCHED|math word problems

  proposition: Zheng Yuan et al. investigated large language models' performance in arithmetic tasks in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zheng Yuan|PUBLISHED_IN|2023

    entity-entity relationships:
    Zheng Yuan|INVESTIGATED|large language models

  proposition: Tianwen Wei et al. developed CMATH to test language models on Chinese elementary school math tests in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Tianwen Wei|PUBLISHED_IN|2023
    CMATH|TYPE|benchmark

    entity-entity relationships:
    Tianwen Wei|DEVELOPED|CMATH

  proposition: Wenxuan Zhang et al. created M3Exam, a multilingual, multimodal, multilevel benchmark for examining large language models in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Wenxuan Zhang|PUBLISHED_IN|2023
    M3Exam|TYPE|benchmark

    entity-entity relationships:
    Wenxuan Zhang|CREATED|M3Exam

  proposition: Dan Hendrycks et al. published a paper on measuring massive multitask language understanding in 2020.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Dan Hendrycks|PUBLISHED_IN|2020

    entity-entity relationships:
    Dan Hendrycks|RESEARCHED|language understanding

  proposition: Zhenwen Liang et al. developed SceMQA, a scientific college entrance level multimodal question answering benchmark in 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zhenwen Liang|PUBLISHED_IN|2024
    SceMQA|TYPE|benchmark

    entity-entity relationships:
    Zhenwen Liang|DEVELOPED|SceMQA

  proposition: Liangtai Sun et al. created SciEval, a multi-level large language model evaluation benchmark in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Liangtai Sun|PUBLISHED_IN|2023
    SciEval|TYPE|benchmark

    entity-entity relationships:
    Liangtai Sun|CREATED|SciEval

  proposition: Pranav Rajpurkar et al. published SQuAD, a dataset with 100,000+ questions for machine comprehension of text in 2016.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Pranav Rajpurkar|PUBLISHED_IN|2016
    SQuAD|TYPE|dataset

    entity-entity relationships:
    Pranav Rajpurkar|PUBLISHED|SQuAD

  proposition: Pranav Rajpurkar et al. also worked on identifying unanswerable questions for SQuAD in 2018.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Pranav Rajpurkar|PUBLISHED_IN|2018

    entity-entity relationships:
    Pranav Rajpurkar|RESEARCHED|SQuAD

  proposition: Zhilin Yang et al. developed HotpotQA, a dataset for diverse, explainable multi-hop question answering in 2018.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zhilin Yang|PUBLISHED_IN|2018
    HotpotQA|TYPE|dataset

    entity-entity relationships:
    Zhilin Yang|DEVELOPED|HotpotQA

  proposition: Mandar Joshi et al. created TriviaQA, a large-scale distantly supervised challenge dataset for reading comprehension in 2017.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Mandar Joshi|PUBLISHED_IN|2017
    TriviaQA|TYPE|dataset

    entity-entity relationships:
    Mandar Joshi|CREATED|TriviaQA

  proposition: Qiao Jin et al. published PubMedQA, a dataset for biomedical research question answering in 2019.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Qiao Jin|PUBLISHED_IN|2019
    PubMedQA|TYPE|dataset

    entity-entity relationships:
    Qiao Jin|PUBLISHED|PubMedQA
